1.title: Episode #3.1
1.plot: Welcome to the new series of Celluloid Dreams. This week we join Euroscript for their annual competition and talk to Cambridge filmmaker Jonathan Howard about his Mad Max spoof, Clinically Insane Max.

2.title: Episode #3.2
2.plot: This week we talk to Calum Rhys about his WW2 drama Our Father, and join Raindance at their festival opening night. We also look forward to the Cambridge Film Festival.

3.title: Episode #3.3
3.plot: This week we talk to Nail Choudhury about his desert journey film, The Stranger. And we have a legend of British cinema, Derek Malcolm, join us from the Raindance film festival.

4.title: Episode #3.4
4.plot: This week we talk to William Papadin and his film starring an orange. We also visit the premiere of the Turkish.Russian documentary Extraordinary People as well as being joined by horror maestro Kate Shenton.

5.title: Episode #3.5
5.plot: This week we talk to artist and filmmaker Lynette Walworth, visiting the London Film Festival. We interview the filmmakers behind the film Flawless and finally discuss the British film Long Forgotten Fields.

6.title: Episode #3.6
6.plot: This week we interview Cambridge based filmmaker Raphael von Blummenthal about his latest film which became a Vimeo Staff Pick. We also talk to IndieGoGo, one of the world's leading film crowd-funding platforms.

7.title: Episode #3.7
7.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

8.title: Episode #3.8
8.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

9.title: Episode #3.9
9.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

10.title: Episode #3.10
10.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

11.title: Episode #3.11
11.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at a vintage year of film festivals from the UK and Europe. We look back at Cannes, Sheffield, London and Raindance.

12.title: Episode #3.12
12.plot: This week we focus on the Cambridge Film Festival, the UK's third longest running film festival.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Episode 2 of Celluloid Dreams. This week a lift based blood-bath, bringing fibre-optic broadband to the country and finally dealing with mental health, from an unusual perspective.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: This week we have an ecclectic mix of films both local and international and news from around the Cambridge area and beyond. We have an interview with the UK-based Indian filmmaker Vignesh Vyas about two of his very non-filmi filmi Bollywood shorts, Swaraj and Imbatti. I am joined by Cambridge filmmaker Kate Madison and we also have Celluloid Deams regulars James Uren and Colin Ramsay talking to us about their latest short, Spirit Cabinet, a spooky spine chiller of a Victorian period drama. And we will see the latest news from Ruptured Screen, one of Cambridge's most ...

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: This week Alex Bell talks to the creators of the short film, Hammer and Tongs and I talk to Lawson Taylor about his Palestinian based short, We Want to Live. And with the Palestine theme, James Murray meets Harvey Stein to talk about his labour of love, A Third Way, Settlers and Palestinians as Neighbours.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Nidhi Gupta meets up and coming filmmakers and looks for hidden gems at the cinema. This week we talk to Chris Jones about the latest entirely crowd-produced feature film Impact50. Mark Hampton joins me to talk about Town vs Gown and we talk to Ita Hozaife talks about her Reel Kids Africa project of promoting filmmaking among the children of Nigeria.

1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Welcome to the new series of Celluloid Dreams, the show revealing emerging filmmakers both locally and internationally. Tis the festival season, and so this series we will be visiting such exotic places as the Cannes film festival and, ahem, Sheffield. In this week's show we have the latest news from Cannes, happening as we speak, an interview with writer, director, documentarian and author, Charles Harris. We feature monks going mad in the locally made short Scriptorium and finally the wonderful Creative Bridges project.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Welcome to Celluloid Dreams, the show revealing emerging filmmakers both locally and internationally. this week we talk to writer Laurence Gouldbourne about his latest work and the current debate on diversity in film and television. We watch Ruptured Screen prepare to write, make and edit and film in 48-hours and their next project and their next project and finally we catch up at what happened in Cannes.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: Welcome to Celluloid Dreams, the show revealing emerging filmmakers both locally and internationally. this week we look back at the making of the sci-fi film challenge, and talk to local filmmaker Kelvin Reynolds about the period drama Emma Rolfe. We also talk about St. Neots' first film festival and finally visit the Independent Film Trust ball.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Welcome to Celluloid Dreams, the show revealing emerging filmmakers both locally and internationally. this week we look at some of the short films that featured at the Cannes Film Festival; we talk to Katherine Hogan about her comedy short Space Detective and we visit the Golden Island Film Festival in North Cyprus.

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: We are at the Sheffield DocFest 2016, and we talk to Jared P Scott, director of the Climate Change and Security film Age of Consequences. We also talk to Gaza filmmaker, Mohamed Jabaly about the powerful documentary Ambulance, about his time with volunteer paramedics during the Gaza war. Finally, we join Hammer & Tong at their latest Reclaim Your Life event, helping former offenders through film.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: We are at the Sheffield Documentary Film Festival, with the directors of Seed and Age of Consequences. We are joined by filmmaker Chamoun Issa and German filmmaker and scientist Julie Effertz.

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

9.plot: This week's Celluloid Dreams Special looks back at some of the best films and emerging filmmakers we have seen this year.

imdb.title: Celluloid Dreams
plot: Nidhi Gupta talks to emerging filmmakers and the hidden gems from the UK and around the world. This week, a focus in the Cambridge African Film Festival.::Nidhi Gupta
